semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Intraoperative and Postprocedural Cerebrovascular Accidents
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Diseases of the Circulatory System > c. Intraoperative and Postprocedural Cerebrovascular Accident

content.full_text: Medical record documentation should clearly specify the cause-and-effect relationship between the medical intervention and the cerebrovascular accident in order to assign a code for intraoperative or postprocedural cerebrovascular accident. Proper code assignment depends on whether it was an infarction or hemorrhage and whether it occurred intraoperatively or postoperatively. If it was a cerebral hemorrhage, code assignment depends on the type of procedure performed. (Evidence: pg no: 53, L59-L63)
